text:
http://www.pinkjuice.com/temp/lin/squiggle/wrong_font.png
Hi,

in the PNG (see above), there's the SVG displayed by ASV, and also displayed by
Squiggle 1.1.1.. ASV uses the specified font Westminster for the word Ruby, so
it's available, but Squiggle uses a different font. I'll try it in 1.5b3.

Here is another test case where the Font is embedded; it doesn't grow out of the
box, but does so in Squiggle:
http://www.pinkjuice.com/temp/lin/squiggle/news_long_line.png
http://www.pinkjuice.com/temp/lin/squiggle/news_long_line.svg
http://www.pinkjuice.com/temp/lin/squiggle/news_long_line_shot.png

Tobi
creator: tobiasreif@pinkjuice.com
tobiasreif@pinkjuice.com
text:
1.5beta3 still uses the wrong font for "Ruby" in
http://www.pinkjuice.com/nix/pics/mascots.svg

creator: deweese@apache.org
text:
Well for news_long_line the difference is probably due to your reliance on
the user agent default font-size.  If you want reproducable results across
user agents it is suggested that you provide the default value for properties
you rely on.

Now for 'mascots.svg' on Linux we think that fonts may need to be added
to the JDK manually (the jre/lib/font.properties file).

The font is embedded, which should ensure reproducible results across
user agents.
creator: tobiasreif@pinkjuice.com

text:
ooops; you mean that font-size="1.1em" should read font-size="4mm" or something
like that?
creator: tobiasreif@pinkjuice.com
